TABLE_COMMENTS.icu_outputevents: Output events for ICU patients including urine output, drainage, etc. Information regarding patient outputs.
TABLE_COMMENTS.icu_d_items: Dictionary of items recorded in ICU event tables. Defines concepts measured in the ICU from ICU monitoring systems. All itemids have values > 220000.
TABLE_COMMENTS.icu_inputevents: Input events for ICU patients including IV medications, fluids, and nutrition. Information documented regarding continuous infusions or intermittent administrations.
TABLE_COMMENTS.icu_datetimeevents: ICU events recorded as dates or times (e.g., date of last dialysis). Contains all date measurements about a patient in the ICU.
TABLE_COMMENTS.icu_procedureevents: Procedures performed in the ICU including ventilation, dialysis, etc. Not a required documentation field, so absence does not indicate procedure was not conducted.
TABLE_COMMENTS.icu_ingredientevents: Ingredients of continuous infusions including nutritional content. Ingredients contained within inputs data for patients.
TABLE_COMMENTS.icu_icustays: ICU stays with admission and discharge times. Defines unique ICU episodes (stay_id). Derived from transfers table, excluding non-ICU wards and merging consecutive ICU stays.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_hcpcsevents: Healthcare Common Procedure Coding System (HCPCS) events for billing. Billed events occurring during the hospitalization including CPT codes.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_d_icd_diagnoses: Dictionary of ICD-9 and ICD-10 diagnosis codes with descriptions. Defines International Classification of Diseases codes for diagnoses used by the hospital for billing.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_prescriptions: Medications prescribed during hospital admissions. Information about prescribed medications including drug names, coded identifiers, product strength, formulary dose, and route of administration.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_d_hcpcs: Dictionary of HCPCS codes with descriptions. Used to acquire human readable definitions for codes used in hcpcsevents table.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_omr: Online Medical Record (OMR) containing miscellaneous information from the EHR. Useful source of outpatient measurements such as blood pressure, weight, height, and BMI.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_drgcodes: Diagnosis Related Groups (DRG) codes used for billing purposes. DRGs are used by the hospital to obtain reimbursement for a patient's hospital stay.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_diagnoses_icd: ICD-9 and ICD-10 diagnoses assigned to hospital admissions. Billed diagnoses for hospitalizations determined by trained persons who read signed clinical notes.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_services: Clinical services responsible for patient care during hospitalization. Describes the service that a patient was admitted under (e.g., surgical, medical).
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_pharmacy: Pharmacy information for prescribed medications including formulary and dosing details. Detailed information regarding filled medications which were prescribed to the patient.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_poe_detail: Detailed information for Provider Order Entry records. Uses Entity-Attribute-Value (EAV) model for flexible description of POE orders.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_emar: Electronic Medication Administration Record (eMAR) - barcode scanning of medications at administration. Records populated by bedside nursing staff scanning barcodes associated with medicine and patient.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_poe: Provider Order Entry (POE) records for orders placed by healthcare providers. General interface through which care providers enter orders for treatments and procedures.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_d_icd_procedures: Dictionary of ICD-9 and ICD-10 procedure codes with descriptions. Defines International Classification of Diseases codes for procedures used by the hospital to bill for care provided.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_patients: Patient demographics including gender, age, and date of death. Core table defining unique patients in the database. Information that is consistent for the lifetime of a patient.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_microbiologyevents: Microbiology culture results and antibiotic sensitivities. Tests to check for infectious growth and assess which antibiotic treatments are most effective.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_procedures_icd: ICD-9 and ICD-10 procedures performed during hospital admissions. Billed procedures for patients during their hospital stay. Contains only procedures billed by the hospital.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_admissions: Hospital admissions for each patient. Defines unique hospital stays (hadm_id). Information regarding a patient's admission to the hospital including timing, demographic information, and admission source.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_transfers: Patient transfers between different care units within the hospital. Physical locations for patients throughout their hospital stay. The icustays table is derived from this table.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_d_labitems: Dictionary of laboratory test items with descriptions. Contains definitions for all itemid associated with lab measurements. Facilitates efficient storage and querying.
TABLE_COMMENTS.hosp_emar_detail: Detailed information for eMAR records including dosing and administration details. Contains information for each medicine administration made in the EMAR table.

icu_outputevents.subject_id: Patient identifier. Unique to a patient.
icu_outputevents.hadm_id: Hospital admission identifier. Unique to a patient hospital stay.
icu_outputevents.stay_id: ICU stay identifier. Unique to a patient ICU stay.
icu_outputevents.storetime: Time at which an observation was manually input or validated by clinical staff.
icu_outputevents.itemid: Identifier for a single measurement type. Links to d_items.
icu_outputevents.value: Amount of a substance at the charttime (usually up to an hour before when exact start time is unknown).
icu_outputevents.valueuom: Unit of measurement for the value.

icu_d_items.itemid: Unique item identifier for ICU measurements. Primary key. All values > 220000 indicating monitoring system source.
icu_d_items.label: Human-readable description of the concept represented by the itemid.
icu_d_items.abbreviation: Common abbreviation for the label (monitoring system only).
icu_d_items.linksto: Table name which contains this itemid (e.g., chartevents, inputevents). Single itemid only used in one event table.
icu_d_items.category: Category of the measurement (e.g., ABG for arterial blood gas, IV Medication for intravenous medications).
icu_d_items.unitname: Unit of measurement used for the itemid. May be null if unit varies, doesn't apply, or is missing.
icu_d_items.param_type: Type of data recorded: date, number, or text field.
icu_d_items.lownormalvalue: Lower bound of normal range for the measurement. Reference range for expected values.
icu_d_items.highnormalvalue: Upper bound of normal range for the measurement. Reference range for expected values.

icu_inputevents.subject_id: Patient identifier. Unique to a patient.
icu_inputevents.hadm_id: Hospital admission identifier. Unique to a patient hospital stay.
icu_inputevents.stay_id: ICU stay identifier. Unique to a patient ICU stay.
icu_inputevents.starttime: Start time of the input event.
icu_inputevents.endtime: End time of the input event.
icu_inputevents.storetime: Time at which an observation was manually input or validated by clinical staff.
icu_inputevents.itemid: Identifier for a single measurement type. Each row corresponds to an instantiation of the same measurement.
icu_inputevents.amount: Amount of a drug or substance administered to the patient between starttime and endtime.
icu_inputevents.rate: Rate at which the drug or substance was administered between starttime and endtime.
icu_inputevents.orderid: Links multiple items contained in the same solution together.
icu_inputevents.linkorderid: Links the same order across multiple instantiations when rate changes.
icu_inputevents.ordercomponenttypedescription: Description of order component type (main order parameter, additive, or mixed solution).
icu_inputevents.totalamount: Total amount of the fluid in the bag containing the solution.
icu_inputevents.isopenbag: Whether the order was from an open bag.
icu_inputevents.statusdescription: Ultimate status of the item: Changed, Paused, FinishedRunning, Stopped, Flushed.
icu_inputevents.originalamount: Amount of drug contained in the bag at starttime.
icu_inputevents.originalrate: Rate that was input by the care provider (may differ from rate due to various reasons).

icu_datetimeevents.subject_id: Patient identifier. Unique to a patient.
icu_datetimeevents.hadm_id: Hospital admission identifier. Unique to a patient hospital stay.
icu_datetimeevents.stay_id: ICU stay identifier. Unique to a patient ward stay.
icu_datetimeevents.charttime: Time at which an observation was charted. Usually closest proxy to when data was measured.
icu_datetimeevents.storetime: Time at which an observation was manually input or validated by clinical staff.
icu_datetimeevents.itemid: Identifier for a single measurement type. Links to d_items.
icu_datetimeevents.value: Documented date - corresponds to the concept referred to by itemid. All dates have been shifted for confidentiality.
icu_datetimeevents.valueuom: Unit of measurement for the value - almost always "Date".
icu_datetimeevents.warning: Specifies if a warning for this observation was manually documented by the care provider.

icu_procedureevents.subject_id: Patient identifier. Unique to a patient.
icu_procedureevents.hadm_id: Hospital admission identifier. Unique to a patient hospital stay.
icu_procedureevents.stay_id: ICU stay identifier. Unique to a patient ICU stay.
icu_procedureevents.storetime: Time when the event was recorded in the system.
icu_procedureevents.itemid: Identifier for a single measurement type. Links to d_items.
icu_procedureevents.value: Duration of the procedure (if applicable). For instantaneous procedures, there is a one second difference between starttime and endtime.
icu_procedureevents.valueuom: Unit of measurement for the value: "None" (no value), "day", "hour", or "min".
icu_procedureevents.location: Information about where on the patient's body the procedure is taking place.
icu_procedureevents.orderid: Links procedures to specific physician orders.
icu_procedureevents.linkorderid: Links repeated procedures under the same original order.
icu_procedureevents.ordercategoryname: Higher level information about the order category.
icu_procedureevents.isopenbag: Whether the order was from an open bag.
icu_procedureevents.continueinnextdept: If order ended on patient transfer, indicates if it continued in next department.
icu_procedureevents.statusdescription: Ultimate status of the procedure: Paused, FinishedRunning, Stopped.
icu_procedureevents.originalamount: Present but has no clear meaning.
icu_procedureevents.originalrate: Present but has no clear meaning (either 0 or 1 for all records).

icu_ingredientevents.subject_id: Patient identifier. Unique to a patient.
icu_ingredientevents.hadm_id: Hospital admission identifier. Unique to a patient hospital stay.
icu_ingredientevents.stay_id: ICU stay identifier. Unique to a patient ICU stay.
icu_ingredientevents.storetime: Time at which an observation was manually input or validated by clinical staff.
icu_ingredientevents.itemid: Identifier for a single measurement type corresponding to an instantiation of the same measurement.
icu_ingredientevents.amount: Amount of a drug or substance administered between starttime and endtime. Derived from rate for convenience.
icu_ingredientevents.rate: Rate at which the drug or substance was administered between starttime and endtime.
icu_ingredientevents.orderid: Links multiple items contained in the same solution together.
icu_ingredientevents.linkorderid: Links the same order across multiple instantiations when rate changes.
icu_ingredientevents.statusdescription: Ultimate status: Changed, Paused, FinishedRunning, Stopped, Rewritten, Flushed.
icu_ingredientevents.originalamount: Amount of the compound contained in the bag at starttime.
icu_ingredientevents.originalrate: Rate that was input by the care provider (may differ from rate column).

icu_icustays.stay_id: Unique ICU stay identifier. Generated identifier not based on raw data. Groups reasonably contiguous episodes of care.
icu_icustays.first_careunit: First ICU type in which the patient was cared for during this stay.
icu_icustays.last_careunit: Last ICU type in which the patient was cared for during this stay.
icu_icustays.intime: ICU admission time. Date and time the patient was transferred into the ICU.
icu_icustays.outtime: ICU discharge time. Date and time the patient was transferred out of the ICU.
icu_icustays.los: Length of stay for the patient for the given ICU stay measured in fractional days.

hosp_hcpcsevents.chartdate: Date associated with the coded event.
hosp_hcpcsevents.hcpcs_cd: Five character code which uniquely represents the event. Links to d_hcpcs for longer description.
hosp_hcpcsevents.seq_num: Assigned order to HCPCS codes for an individual hospitalization. Sometimes conveys priority.
hosp_hcpcsevents.short_description: Short textual description of the hcpcs_cd.

hosp_d_icd_diagnoses.icd_code: International Coding Definitions (ICD) diagnosis code. ICD-9 codes are 5 characters (numeric with E/V prefixes). ICD-10 codes are 3-7 characters (letter prefix + numeric).
hosp_d_icd_diagnoses.icd_version: ICD version (9 or 10). Differentiates between ICD-9 and ICD-10 coding systems.
hosp_d_icd_diagnoses.long_title: Full description of the diagnosis code providing the meaning of the ICD code.

hosp_prescriptions.pharmacy_id: Unique prescription identifier. Links administrations in emar to pharmacy information.
hosp_prescriptions.poe_id: Provider order entry identifier. Links prescriptions to associated orders in the poe table.
hosp_prescriptions.poe_seq: Sequence number for the provider order entry.
hosp_prescriptions.order_provider_id: Anonymous identifier for the provider who initiated the prescription order.
hosp_prescriptions.starttime: Prescribed start time for the medication.
hosp_prescriptions.stoptime: Prescribed stop time for the medication.
hosp_prescriptions.drug_type: Component of the prescription which the drug occupies (MAIN, BASE, or ADDITIVE).
hosp_prescriptions.drug: Free-text description of the prescribed medication.
hosp_prescriptions.formulary_drug_cd: Hospital specific ontology code used to order drugs from the formulary.
hosp_prescriptions.gsn: Generic Sequence Number (GSN), a coded identifier used for medications.
hosp_prescriptions.ndc: National Drug Code (NDC), a coded identifier which uniquely identifies medications.
hosp_prescriptions.prod_strength: Free-text description of the composition of the prescribed medication (e.g., "12 mg / 0.8 mL Oral Syringe").
hosp_prescriptions.form_rx: Container in which the formulary dose is delivered (e.g., TABLET, VIAL).
hosp_prescriptions.dose_val_rx: Prescribed dose for the patient intended to be administered over the given time period.
hosp_prescriptions.dose_unit_rx: Unit of measurement for the prescribed dose.
hosp_prescriptions.form_val_disp: Amount of the medication contained in a single formulary dose.
hosp_prescriptions.form_unit_disp: Unit of measurement used for the formulary dosage.
hosp_prescriptions.doses_per_24_hrs: Number of doses per 24 hours for which the medication is to be given (1=daily, 2=BID, etc.).
hosp_prescriptions.route: Route of administration for the medication.

hosp_d_hcpcs.code: Five character code which uniquely represents the event.
hosp_d_hcpcs.long_description: Long textual description of the code.
hosp_d_hcpcs.short_description: Short textual description of the code.

hosp_omr.chartdate: Date on which the observation was recorded.
hosp_omr.seq_num: Monotonically increasing integer which uniquely distinguishes results of the same type recorded on the same day.
hosp_omr.result_name: Human interpretable description of the observation. Examples: eGFR, Blood Pressure, BMI, Weight, Height.
hosp_omr.result_value: Value associated with the given OMR observation.

hosp_drgcodes.drg_type: Specific DRG ontology used for the code.
hosp_drgcodes.description: Description for the given DRG code.
hosp_drgcodes.drg_severity: DRG ontologies further qualify the patient severity of illness.
hosp_drgcodes.drg_mortality: DRG ontologies further qualify the likelihood of mortality.

hosp_diagnoses_icd.seq_num: Priority assigned to the diagnoses. Can be interpreted as a ranking of which diagnoses are "important" with caveats (e.g., sepsis must be 2nd billed condition).
hosp_diagnoses_icd.icd_code: International Coding Definitions (ICD) diagnosis code. Both ICD-9 and ICD-10 codes included.
hosp_diagnoses_icd.icd_version: ICD version (9 or 10). ICD-10 codes are more detailed than ICD-9 codes.

hosp_services.transfertime: Time at which the patient moved from the prev_service to the curr_service.
hosp_services.prev_service: Previous clinical service that the patient was under.
hosp_services.curr_service: Current clinical service that the patient resides under. Services include CMED (Cardiac Medical), CSURG (Cardiac Surgery), DENT (Dental), ENT (Ear, nose, throat), etc.

hosp_pharmacy.pharmacy_id: Unique identifier for the given pharmacy entry. Can be used to link to provider order or medication administration.
hosp_pharmacy.poe_id: Foreign key which links to the provider order entry order in the prescriptions table.
hosp_pharmacy.starttime: Start time for the given prescribed medication.
hosp_pharmacy.stoptime: Stop time for the given prescribed medication.
hosp_pharmacy.proc_type: Type of order: "IV Piggyback", "Non-formulary", "Unit Dose", etc.
hosp_pharmacy.status: Whether the prescription is active, inactive, or discontinued.
hosp_pharmacy.entertime: Date and time at which the prescription was entered into the pharmacy system.
hosp_pharmacy.verifiedtime: Date and time at which the prescription was verified by a physician.
hosp_pharmacy.route: Intended route of administration for the prescription.
hosp_pharmacy.frequency: Frequency at which the medication should be administered. Q# indicates every # hours.
hosp_pharmacy.disp_sched: Hours of the day at which the medication should be administered (e.g., "08, 20" for 8 AM and 8 PM).
hosp_pharmacy.infusion_type: Coded letter describing the type of infusion: B, C, N, N1, O, or R.
hosp_pharmacy.sliding_scale: Indicates whether the medication should be given on a sliding scale (Y or N).
hosp_pharmacy.lockout_interval: Time the patient must wait until providing themselves with another dose; often used with patient controlled analgesia.
hosp_pharmacy.basal_rate: Rate at which the medication is given over 24 hours.
hosp_pharmacy.one_hr_max: Maximum dose that may be given in a single hour.
hosp_pharmacy.doses_per_24_hrs: Number of expected doses per 24 hours. Can be misleading for continuously infused medications.
hosp_pharmacy.duration: Numeric duration of the given dose.
hosp_pharmacy.duration_interval: Unit of measurement for the given duration (e.g., "Doses", "Weeks").
hosp_pharmacy.expiration_value: Length of time until the drug expires (numeric component).
hosp_pharmacy.dispensation: Source of dispensation for the medication.
hosp_pharmacy.fill_quantity: What proportion of the formulary to fill.

hosp_poe_detail.poe_id: Unique identifier for the given order. Composed of subject_id and poe_seq.
hosp_poe_detail.poe_seq: Monotonically increasing integer which chronologically sorts the POE orders.
hosp_poe_detail.field_name: Name given to a particular aspect of a POE order. Examples: Admit to, Indication, Code status, Transfer to, Admit category, Consult Status, etc.
hosp_poe_detail.field_value: Value associated with the given POE order and field_name.

hosp_emar.emar_id: Unique identifier for each order made in eMAR.
hosp_emar.emar_seq: Consecutive integer which numbers eMAR orders chronologically.
hosp_emar.poe_id: Provider order entry identifier linking administrations to orders in poe and prescriptions.
hosp_emar.pharmacy_id: Pharmacy record identifier linking to pharmacy information.
hosp_emar.enter_provider_id: Anonymous identifier for the provider who entered the information into the eMAR system.
hosp_emar.charttime: Time at which the medication was administered.
hosp_emar.medication: Name of the medication which was administered.
hosp_emar.event_txt: Information about the administration. Most frequently "Administered", but other values include "Applied", "Confirmed", "Delayed", "Not Given".
hosp_emar.scheduletime: If present, the time at which the administration was scheduled.
hosp_emar.storetime: Time at which the administration was documented in the eMAR table.

hosp_poe.poe_id: Unique identifier for the given order. Composed of subject_id and poe_seq in format: subject_id-poe_seq.
hosp_poe.poe_seq: Monotonically increasing integer which chronologically sorts the POE orders.
hosp_poe.ordertime: Date and time at which the provider order was made.
hosp_poe.order_type: Type of provider order: ADT orders, Blood Bank, Cardiology, Consults, Critical Care, General Care, Hemodialysis, IV therapy, Lab, Medications, Neurology, Nutrition, OB, Radiology, Respiratory, TPN.
hosp_poe.order_subtype: Further detail on the type of order made by the provider. Best interpreted alongside order_type.
hosp_poe.transaction_type: Action which the provider performed when performing this order: Change, Co, D/C, H, New, T.
hosp_poe.discontinue_of_poe_id: Links to the previous order which was discontinued by this order.
hosp_poe.discontinued_by_poe_id: Links to the future order which discontinued this order.
hosp_poe.order_provider_id: Anonymous identifier for the provider who made the order.
hosp_poe.order_status: Whether the order is still active (Active) or has been inactivated (Inactive).

hosp_d_icd_procedures.icd_version: ICD version (9 or 10). Differentiates between ICD-9 and ICD-10 coding systems.
hosp_d_icd_procedures.long_title: Brief definition for the given procedure code.

hosp_patients.subject_id: Unique patient identifier which specifies an individual patient. Any rows associated with a single subject_id pertain to the same individual. Primary key for the table.
hosp_patients.gender: The genotypical sex of the patient (M/F).
hosp_patients.anchor_age: Patient's age in the anchor_year. If a patient's anchor_age is over 89 in the anchor_year then their anchor_age is set to 91, regardless of how old they actually were.
hosp_patients.anchor_year: A shifted year for the patient. Used for date shifting to protect patient confidentiality.
hosp_patients.anchor_year_group: A range of years - the patient's anchor_year occurred during this range (e.g., 2008-2010).
hosp_patients.dod: The de-identified date of death for the patient. Date of death is extracted from hospital information system and state registry of vital records. Out of hospital mortality is available up to one year post-hospital discharge.

hosp_microbiologyevents.micro_specimen_id: Uniquely denotes the specimen from which the microbiology measurement was made. Groups measurements made on the same sample.
hosp_microbiologyevents.order_provider_id: Anonymous identifier for the provider who ordered the microbiology test.
hosp_microbiologyevents.chartdate: Date of the measurement. All observations have a chartdate.
hosp_microbiologyevents.charttime: Time at which an observation was charted. Usually closest proxy to when data was measured. May be null.
hosp_microbiologyevents.spec_itemid: Item ID for the specimen type.
hosp_microbiologyevents.spec_type_desc: Description of specimen type (e.g., BLOOD CULTURE).
hosp_microbiologyevents.test_seq: Delineates multiple samples if drawn (e.g., aerobic and anaerobic culture bottles).
hosp_microbiologyevents.storedate: Date when the microbiology result was available.
hosp_microbiologyevents.storetime: Date and time when the microbiology result was available.
hosp_microbiologyevents.test_itemid: Item ID for the test performed on the specimen.
hosp_microbiologyevents.test_name: Name of the test performed on the given specimen.
hosp_microbiologyevents.org_itemid: Item ID for the organism, if any, which grew when tested.
hosp_microbiologyevents.org_name: Name of the organism which grew. If NULL, no organism grew (negative culture).
hosp_microbiologyevents.isolate_num: For testing antibiotics, the isolated colony (integer starting at 1).
hosp_microbiologyevents.ab_itemid: Item ID for antibiotic tested against the given organism for sensitivity.
hosp_microbiologyevents.ab_name: Name of antibiotic tested for sensitivity.
hosp_microbiologyevents.dilution_text: Dilution values when testing antibiotic sensitivity (text format).
hosp_microbiologyevents.dilution_value: Numerical dilution value when testing antibiotic sensitivity.
hosp_microbiologyevents.interpretation: Interpretation of antibiotic sensitivity: S=sensitive, R=resistant, I=intermediate, P=pending.
hosp_microbiologyevents.comments: Deidentified free-text comments. Fully deidentified comments appear as three underscores (___). NULL indicates no comment.

hosp_procedures_icd.seq_num: Assigned priority for procedures which occurred within the hospital stay.
hosp_procedures_icd.chartdate: Date of the associated procedures. Date does not strictly correlate with seq_num.
hosp_procedures_icd.icd_version: ICD version (9 or 10). Differentiates between ICD-9 and ICD-10 coding systems.

hosp_admissions.subject_id: Patient identifier. Links to patients table.
hosp_admissions.hadm_id: Unique hospital admission identifier. Each unique hospital visit for a patient is assigned a unique hadm_id. Ranges from 2000000-2999999.
hosp_admissions.admittime: Hospital admission date and time. Date and time the patient was admitted to the hospital.
hosp_admissions.dischtime: Hospital discharge date and time. Date and time the patient was discharged from the hospital.
hosp_admissions.deathtime: Time of in-hospital death for the patient. Only present if the patient died in-hospital, and is almost always the same as dischtime.
hosp_admissions.admission_type: Type of admission classifying urgency. Possible values: AMBULATORY OBSERVATION, DIRECT EMER., DIRECT OBSERVATION, ELECTIVE, EU OBSERVATION, EW EMER., OBSERVATION ADMIT, SURGICAL SAME DAY ADMISSION, URGENT.
hosp_admissions.admit_provider_id: Anonymous identifier for the provider who admitted the patient.
hosp_admissions.admission_location: Location from which the patient was admitted (e.g., emergency room, clinic referral).
hosp_admissions.discharge_location: Location to which the patient was discharged (e.g., home, skilled nursing facility).
hosp_admissions.insurance: Primary insurance for the patient during this hospitalization.
hosp_admissions.edregtime: Date and time at which the patient was registered in the emergency department.
hosp_admissions.edouttime: Date and time at which the patient was discharged from the emergency department.
hosp_admissions.hospital_expire_flag: Binary flag indicating whether the patient died within the given hospitalization (1=died in hospital, 0=survived to discharge).

hosp_transfers.subject_id: Patient identifier. Unique to a patient.
hosp_transfers.hadm_id: Hospital admission identifier. Unique to a patient hospital stay.
hosp_transfers.transfer_id: Transfer identifier. Unique to a patient physical location.
hosp_transfers.eventtype: Type of transfer event: "ed" for emergency department stay, "admit" for hospital admission, "transfer" for intra-hospital transfer, "discharge" for hospital discharge.
hosp_transfers.careunit: Type of unit or ward in which the patient is physically located (e.g., medical ICUs, surgical ICUs, medical wards, new baby nurseries).
hosp_transfers.intime: Date and time the patient was transferred into the current care unit from the previous care unit.
hosp_transfers.outtime: Date and time the patient was transferred out of the current physical location.

hosp_d_labitems.itemid: Unique identifier for a laboratory concept. Can be used to identify data in labevents.
hosp_d_labitems.label: Description of the concept represented by the itemid.
hosp_d_labitems.fluid: Substance on which the measurement was made (e.g., BLOOD, urine). Differentiates distinct concepts.
hosp_d_labitems.category: Higher level information about the type of measurement (e.g., ABG for arterial blood gas).

hosp_emar_detail.emar_id: Unique identifier for each order made in eMAR.
hosp_emar_detail.emar_seq: Consecutive integer which numbers eMAR orders chronologically.
hosp_emar_detail.parent_field_ordinal: Delineates multiple administrations for the same eMAR event. NULL for main row, then 1.1, 1.2, etc. for multiple formulary doses.
hosp_emar_detail.administration_type: Type of administration including "IV Bolus", "IV Infusion", "Medication Infusion", "Transdermal Patch", etc.
hosp_emar_detail.pharmacy_id: Identifier linking the eMAR order to pharmacy information.
hosp_emar_detail.barcode_type: Type of barcode used during administration.
hosp_emar_detail.reason_for_no_barcode: Reason if no barcode was used during administration.
hosp_emar_detail.complete_dose_not_given: Indicator if complete dose was not given.
hosp_emar_detail.dose_due: Dose that was due to be administered.
hosp_emar_detail.dose_due_unit: Unit for the dose that was due.
hosp_emar_detail.dose_given_unit: Unit for the dose that was given.
hosp_emar_detail.will_remainder_of_dose_be_given: Indicator for whether remainder of dose will be given.
hosp_emar_detail.new_iv_bag_hung: Indicator if new IV bag was hung.
